title: 115_s3216
content: The Act is titled the "Justice for Native Survivors of Sexual Violence Act" and grants tribal jurisdiction over crimes of domestic, dating, or sexual violence, sex trafficking, or stalking. Section 204 of Public Law 90-284 (25 U.S.C. 1304), also known as the "Indian Civil Rights Act of 1968," is amended to include jurisdiction over crimes of domestic, dating, or sexual violence, sex trafficking, or stalking by Indian tribes. The amendment to Section 204 of Public Law 90-284 expands the jurisdiction of Indian tribes to include crimes of domestic, dating, or sexual violence, sex trafficking, or stalking. It also redefines the term "related conduct" as conduct alleged to have been committed by a defendant that violates criminal law. The term 'sex trafficking' refers to conduct involving recruiting, enticing, harboring, transporting, providing, obtaining, advertising, maintaining, patronizing, or soliciting a person, and benefiting financially. The text chunk describes the act of benefiting financially or receiving anything of value from participation in a venture engaged in sex trafficking, carried out with knowledge or reckless disregard of force, fraud, coercion, or other means used to cause a person to engage in a commercial sex act. The curr_chunk defines terms related to sex trafficking, including coercion, commercial sex act, and sexual violence. It also addresses the age of the victim and lack of consent in cases of sexual violence. The curr_chunk amends definitions related to stalking by replacing "domestic violence" with "tribal" and defining stalking as a course of conduct causing fear or emotional distress. The curr_chunk modifies subsection (c) by replacing "domestic violence" with "tribal" and updating definitions related to stalking. The curr_chunk updates definitions related to stalking, sex trafficking, and related conduct in Indian country, and replaces "domestic violence" with "tribal" in subsection (d). The curr_chunk updates definitions for crimes in Indian country related to domestic violence, dating violence, sexual violence, stalking, sex trafficking, and related conduct.
